title: matikanefukukitaru_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]].

The fortune-telling horse girl with a really long name (and meant to be read as [i]Machikane Fukukitaru[/i]), Matikanefukukitaru is obsessed about fortune and luck and collects a wild range of lucky charms. The other horse girls (and humans at times) often consult her with their luck as well. She often refers to a "Shiraoki-sama" as if they were a shinto deity (and indeed, a horse named Shiraoki is the RL horse's 5th generation mare line ancestor).

Her name, when read as a whole, roughly means "Good fortune comes to those who wait".

Her real life counterpart also has the same long name. This is originally intended to be "Machikane Fukukitaru", but later shortened to "Matikanefukukitaru" because of a maximum 18 letter limit on the international rules for racehorse names. Here, Machikane/Matikane is a [i]kanmei[/i] and many of the owner's horses have limit-filling names like these (See [[Matikane Tannhauser (Umamusume)|]] as well).

h4. Appearance

title: seeking_the_pearl_(umamusume)
body:
a [[Umamusume]] who doesn't just want to be a small speck in history. Having lived in many different countries growing up, she wants to show that with her body, anything in the world can happen. And she can prove it, delivering great results in short and mile races with a smile on her face.

She is also considered a big sister figure among younger [[horse girl|horse girls]] because of her life. However, despite all her traveling, she actually doesn't speak English. She mitigates this comfortably by using body language.

title: haru_urara_(umamusume)
body:
[i][[Umamusume]][/i] character. A very cheerful and friendly [[horse girl]] who never gives up. She is from Kochi, in Shikoku (the original horse's career was entirely spent racing in local races in Kochi).

Her real life counterpart is known not for winning (or even for having the longest losing streak, for that matter), but rather for her persistence in the face of a very long string of consecutive losses (no victories in [b][i]113[/i][/b] races); she was profiled in a 2016 short film, "The Shining Star of Losers Everywhere":[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt5424802].

title: hokko_tarumae_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i].

Tomakomai's very own idol horse girl. She is named after Mount Tarumae, a nearby volcano. Part of the Dirt Trio, she is usually depicted as the most level-headed member of the trio, having to rein in Copano Rickey's Feng Shui evangelism as well as Wonder Acute's granny tendencies. However, she's still a very enthusiastic evangelist of her hometown, being it's Tourism Ambassador. She is often depicted with many things pertaining to Tomakomai, such as [[haskap|haskap berries]] and fellow city mascot [[Tomachop]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair|purple]] [[messy hair]] with [[double-parted bangs|double-parted]] [[crossed bangs]] reaching [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]] and an [[ahoge]]. title: tsukumo_sana
body:
A former [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]] who was part of [[hololive English]]'s [[holoCouncil|second generation]]. Designed by [[pako (pakosun)|pako]].

She has [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]], [[large breasts]], [[yellow eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[light brown hair]] (also occasionally depicted with [[blonde hair|light blonde hair]]) which she keeps in [[twintails]] with [[planet hair ornament|planet-themed]] [[hair ornament]]s and [[sidelocks]]. The said ornaments were occupied by a then-unnamed rabbit-like and crab-like creatures on her right hand and left hand side respectively. They were later named [[Usaslug (Tsukumo Sana)|]] and [[Kaniko (Tsukumo Sana)|]].

body:

List of characters from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

h4. Playable characters

Playable characters are divided into one of 5 categories: three for Ark Nikkes (based on which of the Big Three Ark corporations manufactured them), one for surface Nikkes, and one for crossover characters.

h5. Elysion

Uphold the belief in Nikkes serving as first-rate soldiers, Elysion effectively serves as a private military corporation. Its CEO is [[Ingrid (nikke)|]].

h4. Squads

Nikke are grouped into named squads of 1-4 members. Usually squads have a particular role or specialization, which often is reflected in the squad name or in their individual names. Rarely a Nikke may leave one squad to join another, either temporarily or permanently, and under extraordinary circumstances a squad may be dissolved. title: kamen_rider_meteor
body:
Secondary Rider of [[Kamen Rider Fourze (series)|Kamen Rider Fourze]].

His real name is [[Sakuta Ryuusei|Sakuta Ryusei]], a member of the Anti-Zodiarts Union who also doubles as the rival and eventual friend of [[Kisaragi Gentarou|Kisaragi Gentaro]] and [[Kamen Rider Fourze]].

Unlike Fourze, his powers come from the M-BUS [[satellite]] [[space station]] in Earth's orbit above Japan, which holds necessary energy for Meteor to transform. Cosmic Energy is received to complete Kamen Rider Meteor's transformation.

However, if Ryusei is not exposed to this energy, he is not able to transform. After transforming into Kamen Rider Meteor, he says "Kamen Rider Meteor, your fate is mine to decide!", though [[Joujima Yuki|Yuki]] will yell out "The Meteor is Here!" everytime Meteor arrives in his blue fireball form. His helmet is called the Star Face.

By swapping the Meteor Storm Switch with the Meteor Switch in the Meteor Driver, then spin the fan on the Switch after activating it, he can transform into the stronger Kamen Rider Meteor Storm, gaining in both power and speed. After changing into Kamen Rider Meteor Storm, Ryusei says "Kamen Rider Meteor Storm, my fate will deliver a storm!". His helmet is upgraded into the "Starlight Face".

In this form, he gain the access to a new weapon, the Meteor Storm Shaft, which is a gun rod-like weapon.

title: aerith_gainsborough
body:
Playable character from [[Final Fantasy VII]], featured in the Compilation ([[final fantasy vii advent children|Advent Children]], [[before crisis final fantasy vii|Before Crisis]], [[crisis core final fantasy vii|Crisis Core]]) and the [[final fantasy vii remake|Remake]]. Also a supporting character in the [[Kingdom Hearts]] series. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] worn in a [[twisted hair|twisted ponytail]] (often mistakenly depicted as a [[braided ponytail]]) with [[parted bangs]] and [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[sidelocks]], fastened with a [[pink ribbon|pink]] [[hair ribbon]] and sometimes a visible green [[materia]], [[green eyes]], [[medium breasts]], sometimes [[pale skin]], a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[red jacket]] with [[short sleeves]] ([[puffy short sleeves]] in the original [[Final Fantasy VII|FFVII]]) over a [[long dress|long]] [[pink dress|pink]] [[sleeveless dress]] with [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]], a [[flower choker]] (simple [[ribbon choker]] prior to [[Final Fantasy VII Remake|FF7R]]) and [[bangle]]s on each wrist. Often carries a [[yellow flower]] and [[flower basket]] and wields a [[staff]].

She was first voiced in English by Mandy Moore in Kingdom Hearts, she was later voiced by Mena Suvari in Kingdom Hearts II and Advent Children, then by Andrea Bowen in Crisis Core and Kingdom Hearts III.  Her voice in the remake and Crisis Core Reunion is performed by Briana White.  Her voice in all Japanese media is performed by [[Sakamoto Maaya]].

First known abroad as [i]Aeris[/i].

body:

title: winchester_model_1887
body:
The [b]Winchester Model 1887[/b] is a [[lever action]] [[shotgun]] designed by [[john moses browning|John Browning]] and produced by the Winchester Repeating Arms Company, maker of the famous [[Winchester model 1873|Winchester rifles]]. It was one of the first successful repeating shotgun designs, but was done so before the proliferation of smokeless gunpowder, which proved too powerful for the design to contain. In addition, [[pump action]] shotguns proved more popular for the new gunpowder mixture, and after the advent of the [[Winchester Model 1897]], interest in the older model quickly waned. 

The Model 1887 was saved from relative obscurity, however, by its use in the 1991 movie [[Terminator 2: Judgment Day]], after which the [[weapon]] and the distinctive flip maneuver used to rechamber it became cultural icons. In Anime, the Model 1887 is recognized for its use by [[tsurugi (blue archive)|Tsurugi]] and [[mine (blue archive)|Mine]] in [[Blue Archive]], though even these tend to be done as references themselves to Terminator.

title: heattech_leotard
body:
A [[meme attire|meme outfit]] consisting of a [[turtleneck leotard]] made of a ribbed material resembling a sweater. The outfit is sold by [[Uniqlo]] and is made of HeatTech, a thin material designed to wick away moisture and hold body heat. The outfit comes in [[red leotard|red]], [[black leotard|black]], or [[grey leotard|grey]].

The leotards worn by the [[Shadaloo Dolls]] are visually similar except for the neckties, but they should not be referred as such due to the difference in colors as well as overall design. The leotard as sold by Uniqlo is not a thong leotard and does not have the backless design. Furthermore, it is secured by buttons at the crotch.

This tag used to be referred to as "[[turtleneck leotard]]," but the ambiguity of the tag name led to it being populated by images with literal turtleneck leotards and not necessarily the HeatTech one, thus the need for the rename.

* !asset #24772131

title: tag_group:verbs_and_gerunds
body:
This tag group defines and sorts action-related tags according to their definition as a verb or a gerund. There is often debate regarding what tags should be used as a verb or a gerund, so this page should hopefully clear up any disambiguation. If there are any alias or implication changes made to a verb or gerund tag, it should be updated here as well.

h4.Verbs

Refers to a "finite verb":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Finite_verb conveying an action, an occurrence, or a state of being (with the verb [i]to be[/i]). It is very difficult to write a complete sentence without using a verb in the English language. They can be written in three different tenses; past, present and future. On Danbooru, [b]they are written in "present participle":http://www.edufind.com/english/grammar/present_participle.php to denote that a character is doing something at that moment in the image.[/b] The action might be a freeze frame for us (unless it's an animated image), but it is occurring for them in the present and should be tagged as such. A lot of verbs are written in the present tense for this reason, many ending with -ing. If you can also call that verb an object, it should be listed in the gerunds category. This group is for words that can only possibly be treated as an action.

h4.Gerunds

For Danbooru's purposes, a gerund is a "non-finite verb":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Non-finite_verb that can also function as a noun. A verb written in -ing form can be turned into a subject or noun depending on how the sentence is structured. For instance, let's use the sentence, "Tagging images on Danbooru helps to narrow down a search". The gerund here is [i]tagging[/i] because it is being treated as the subject rather than the action; the actual verb here is [i]helps[/i] because it is describing how useful tagging is.

As stated above, and mainly for this site, an -ing verb can also refer to an actual object, not just a verb being turned into a subject. Examples including [i]building[/i] (the act of constructing something vs. the actual structure itself), [i]drawing[/i] (the act of doodling on paper vs. the completed picture itself), or [i]wedding[/i] (the act of being wed vs. the ceremony). [b]If you're able to call an -ing word both a verb and a noun, it should fall under this list as a gerund.[/b] Many of these gerunds already have the -ing verb aliased to them, and their wikis often have the phrases, "As a verb, it is the act of..." followed by, "As a noun..." to clarify the term both as an action and an object.

title: yoru_mac
body:
[[McDonald's]] Japan's post-5pm menu line-up, known as Yoru Mac (literally "Night Mac", with the alternate name of "McDonald's in the Night"), introduced in June 2017 first in Aichi, Gifu and Mie Prefecture, before being expanded nation-wide in March 2018. Several different products have come and gone as part of the line-up, and in turn, so too have several advertising campaigns.

In Autumn 2023, one such advertisement campaign launched, running from late September to early November, focused on depicting characters (ex. a family, a group of friends, etc. hanging out together) happily enjoying items from the line-up, in commercials animated by [[uraura ura-chan]]. The main mascots of the campaign are a set of Halloween characters, originally first appearing in a Spring 2023 Yoru Mac advertising campaign called "Yoru Mac Manager", even receiving their own dedicated commercial (post #6713997). The six commercials that released would collectively be entitled the "Yoru Mac Anime Series" by McDonald's.

One of the commercials, depicting a [[mother (yoru mac)|]], [[father (yoru mac)|]] and [[daughter (yoru mac)|]] (post #6702154), unexpectedly went viral on western Twitter, resulting in tons of fanart. Later, another commercial featuring a [[boyfriend (yoru mac)|]] and [[girlfriend (yoru mac)|]] (post #6834868) received similar amounts of attention.

A year later, in Autumn 2024, coinciding with the "McDonald's Favorite Character Grand Prix":[https://twitter.com/McDonaldsJapan/status/1834766516807475527], another commercial featuring the family from the first commercial was made (post #8169424), with the Halloween character keychains being swapped out for a Grimace keychain.

h4. List of animated commercials

h5. 2023 Yoru Mac Anime Series

* post #6702154: [[Mother (yoru mac)|]], [[Father (yoru mac)|]] and [[Daughter (yoru mac)|]]

* post #6834868: [[Boyfriend (yoru mac)|]] and [[Girlfriend (yoru mac)|]]

title: vulcan
body:
A fictional humanoid [[alien]] race from the [[Star Trek]] series. They all have straight [[black hair]], [[pointy ears]] and funny eyebrows. 

[b]Vulcans[/b] were one of the first intelligent alien races that made contact with the human race. They are an important part of the [i]United Federation of Planets[/i] and helped to create it with the humans and many other pacific alien races.

Vulcans value logic, harmony, intelligence and serenity above everything else. However, despite their pacifist nature and culture they have super human strength, are very well trained in personal self-defense and can be very smart and highly capable warriors when the situation requires it. They also have very long lifespans.

In their past, Vulcans and [[Romulan]]s shared the same origins and both originated from a barbaric and war-mongering race. As time passed the Vulcan culture changed and evolved into a very intelectual and logic ridden peaceful species. The Romulan race, however, continued with its war-like tendencies.

h4.See also

* [[Spock]]
* [[Vulcan salute]]

title: asashimo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Asashimo[/i]. Character designed by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Kayano Ai]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[multicolored hair]] ([[grey hair|grey]] on the outside and [[purple hair|purple]] on the inside) and tied to a [[ponytail]], [[hair over one eye|hair covering her right eye]], [[grey eyes]], [[sharp teeth]], and [[small breasts]]. 

Her default outfit is the [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class [[school uniform]] which consists of a purple [[halterneck]] [[dress]] over a [[white shirt]], a teal-blue [[bowtie]] and [[grey pantyhose|grey]]/[[purple pantyhose|purple]] opaque [[pantyhose]] with [[lace-up boots]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and mast as a backpack, a 12.7 cm twin gun mount, and 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. 

On her kai form, she gains a white [[headband]], AA guns and a [[single thighhigh]] on her left leg is overlaid on her pantyhose (emulating Yamato as an [[Operation Ten-Gou]] participant).

title: yuki_miku_(2010)
body:
The first version of [[Yuki Miku]], released in 2010, featuring a simple recoloring of [[Hatsune Miku]]'s outfit. Her outfit has a blue and silver/white theme with a [[blue necktie]], [[white shirt]], [[grey sleeves]] and [[grey thighhighs|thighhighs]]. Her necktie and hair have [[snowflake print|snowflake prints]].

Her fan nicknames include 初代 ([i]shodai[/i]/ Founder), 初雪([i]hatsuyuki[/i]/ First Snow), or rarely 無印 ([i]mujirushi[/i]/ Unlabeled).

title: galaxy_expedition_team_survey_corps_uniform
body:
The uniform worn by members of the Galaxy Expedition Team's Survey Corps in [i][[Pokemon Legends: Arceus|Pokémon Legends: Arceus]][/i]. Almost always worn by [[Akari (pokemon)|]] and [[Rei (pokemon)|]].

The male uniform consists of a tight [[black shirt]], a [[blue kimono]]-like [[jacket]] ([[hanten_(clothes)|hanten]]), an [[obi]] with the Survey Corps' [[satchel]], [[blue pants|blue]] and [[grey pants|grey]] [[gradient pants]], [[grey socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[sandals]]. Additionally, Rei wears a [[red scarf]] and a [[red headwear|red]] [[beret]] with a symbol [[print headwear|printed]] on it.

The female uniform consists of a tight [[black shirt]], a [[blue kimono]]-like [[jacket]] ([[hanten_(clothes)|hanten]]), an [[obi]] with the Survey Corps' [[satchel]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] and [[grey skirt|grey]] kimono-like [[gradient skirt]], [[blue leggings]], [[white leg warmers]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[sandals]]. Captain [[Cyllene (pokemon)|]], however, wears [[black leggings|black]] and grey [[gradient legwear|gradient]] leggings, and grey socks. Additionally, Akari wears a [[red scarf]] and a [[white headwear|white]] [[headscarf]] with a symbol [[print headwear|printed]] on it.

Official art:

* Rei: post #4381920
* Akari: post #4381919
* Cyllene: post #4712918

title: pearl_clan_outfit
body:
The outfit worn by members of the Pearl Clan in [i][[Pokemon Legends: Arceus|Pokémon Legends: Arceus]][/i].

It consists of a [[white hoodie]] with a [[Palkia]]-themed hood, over what appears to be a [[white kimono|white]] and [[pink kimono|pink]] [[two-tone kimono]], and a [[brown bag]]. The hoodie has the Clan's emblem on its chest. The male outfit has [[brown pants|brown]] or [[black pants]] while the female one has [[purple legwear|purple]] and [[grey leggings|grey]] [[gradient legwear|gradient]] [[leggings]]. The outfit also has [[white footwear|white]] and [[red footwear|red]] [[boots]], which are longer in the male outfit.

While generic NPCs wear the same clothes, wardens wear variations of this outfit, mostly with some accessory, or pants or leggings with a different color.

title: ych_commission
body:
A type of [[commission]] (short for "Your Character Here") where the artist uploads an art piece featuring a template character, allowing others to  commission a finished version of the piece wherein the "template" character is replaced with the commissioner's [[original|original character]]. 

For tagging purposes, this may refer to either the template or finished version of the image.

h4. See also
* [[Commission]]
* [[Head swap]]

title: anathema_psykana
body:
[b]The Sisters of Silence[/b], also known as the [b]Anathema Psykana[/b] or [b]Silent Sisterhood[/b], are an ancient, anti-psychic militant order. They are the militant arm of the Adeptus Astra Telepathica and are internally referred to as the organization's Departmento Investigates. However, their affiliation with this body is largely symbolic, and in truth they are an autonomous military force answering directly to the Emperor and the Lord Commander of the Imperium.

Together with the [[Adeptus Custodes]] they represented the Talons of the Emperor, with the Sisters as the left hand of the Emperor. Fragmenting after the Horus Heresy, they were brought back under Imperial control by [[Roboute Guilliman]] in M42. Their ranks consist entirely of blanks.

title: nintendo_64
body:
[b]Nintendo 64[/b] (stylized as NINTENDO⁶⁴) is [[Nintendo]]'s third home video [[game console]] for the international market. 

Named for its 64-bit central processing unit, it was released in June 1996 in Japan, September 1996 in North America, March 1997 in Europe and Australia, September 1997 in France and December 1997 in Brazil. 

As part of the fifth generation of gaming, it primarily competed with the [[Sony]] [[PlayStation 1]] and the [[Sega Saturn]]. The N64 was discontinued in 2002 in Japan, North America and PAL regions by the launch of Nintendo's [[GameCube]].

It was Nintendo's last home console to use ROM cartridges to store games, until the [[Nintendo Switch]] was released.

h4. See also

* [[List of game consoles]]
* [[Nintendo 64DD]]

title: taoism
body:
[b]Taoism[/b] (/ˈdaʊɪzəm/), also known as [b]Daoism[/b], is a religious or philosophical tradition of Chinese origin which emphasizes living in harmony with the [i]Tao[/i] (道, literally "Way", also romanized as [i]Dao[/i]). 

The Tao is a fundamental idea in most Chinese philosophical schools; in Taoism, however, it denotes the principle that is both the source, pattern and substance of everything that exists.

Taoism differs from Confucianism by not emphasizing rigid rituals and social order.

Taoist ethics vary depending on the particular school, but in general tend to emphasize [i]wu wei[/i] (effortless action), "naturalness", simplicity, spontaneity, and the Three Treasures: 慈 "compassion", 儉 "frugality", and 不敢為天下先 "humility".

h4. See also

* [[Bagua]]
* [[Yin Yang]]

body:
The Witcher and main character of [[the Witcher_(series)|]] series and books. The games and series are focused around him.

An old, yet young (by witcher standards) witcher. Trained by [[vesemir of kaer morhen|Vesemir]] in Kaer Mohren, Kaedwen, in the School of the Wolf Witcher "arts". He's become [[ciri|Cirilla's]] foster father.

Has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[yellow eyes|amber eyes]], a [[stubble]], sometimes a [[beard]] and a very [[muscular male|muscular physique]].

Was simply Geralt when he entered the Witcher academy, chose the name Geralt Roger Eric du Haute-Bellegarde, kept he simpler Geralt of Rivia, after a battle he was officially knighted Geralt "of Rivia".

title: sephira_summers_(parasyte123)
body: Original character belonging to artist Parasyte123. She is the daughter of his character Allie Summers and is named after the sapphire jewel and Zephyr, the west wind, leading her name to mean "Jewel of hope." She has a bit of a sassy streak and is an avid gamer, but is a talented writer and has a heart of gold as she's always looking out for her sisters and friends. [[Mazda Montgomery (DLShowtime)]] is her younger half-sister as they share the same father.

title: sega_game_gear
body:
[[Sega]]'s handheld gaming console released in 1990, designed to compete against the [[Game Boy]]. The Game Gear could not beat it in sales due to a short battery life, lack of original titles, and weak support from Sega. 

Despite its shortcomings, many of the ports of Sega games from other systems (Among them [[shinobi_(game)|Shinobi]], [[Golden Axe]], [[Alien Syndrome]], [[Phantasy Star]], etc.) for the Game Gear had unique features exclusive for this handheld and got very good reviews.   

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Sega Game Gear":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sega_Game_Gear

title: pc_engine
body:
The NEC [b]PC Engine[/b] (PCエンジン [i]Pī Shī Enjin[/i]), known in the west as the [b]TurboGrafx-16 Entertainment SuperSystem[/b], is a [[video game]] console joint-developed by [[Hudson]] Soft and [[NEC Corporation]], released in Japan on October 30, 1987, and in the United States on August 19, 1989. It was the first console released in the 16-bit era, albeit still utilizing an 8-bit CPU. Originally intended to "beat" the Nintendo [[Famicom]] (which it achieved in Japan), it ended up competing against the likes of the [[Sega Mega Drive]], [[Super Famicom]], and even the [[Neo Geo]] AES.

The TurboGrafx-16 has an 8-bit CPU and a dual 16-bit GPU; and is capable of displaying 482 colors simultaneously, out of 512. With dimensions of 14 cm×14 cm×3.8 cm (5.5 in×5.5 in×1.5 in), [b]the NEC PC Engine holds the record for the world's smallest game console ever made[/b].

In the United Kingdom, Telegames released a slightly altered version of the American model simply as the TurboGrafx around 1990 in extremely limited quantities. Although there was no full-scale PAL region release of the system, imported PC Engine consoles were largely available in France and Benelux through major retailers thanks to the unlicensed importer Sodipeng (Société de Distribution de la PC Engine, a subsidiary of Guillemot International).

In Japan, the PC Engine was very successful. It gained strong third-party support and outsold the Famicom at its 1987 debut, eventually becoming the Super Famicom's main rival. However, the TurboGrafx-16 failed to break into the North American market and sold poorly, which has been blamed on the delayed release and inferior marketing. 

At least 17 distinct models of the console were made, including portable versions and those that integrated the CD-ROM add-on. An enhanced model, the PC Engine SuperGrafx, was rushed to market in 1989. It featured many performance enhancements and was intended to supersede the standard PC Engine. It failed to catch on—only six titles were released that took advantage of the added power and it was quickly discontinued. The final model was discontinued in 1994. 

Two major revisions, the [[PC Engine SuperGrafx]] and the PC Engine Duo, were released in 1989 and 1991, respectively. The entire series was succeed by the unsuccessful PC-FX in 1994, which was only released in Japan after the TurboGrafx-16 and its revised variants failed to gain enough market share in North America.

Note that this tag is for a game console. For a personal computer (PC), use [[computer]] instead.

h4. See also
* [[List of game consoles]]

title: agent_spider
body:
[b]Agent Spider[/b] is a fictional superhero from the animated series [[Invincible (series)|]]. The character is an expy of the [[Marvel]] superhero [[Spider-Man]], as a nod to the crossover the two comicbook series had. However, due to licensing issues, Spider-Man couldn't appear in the Invincible animated series which led to the creation of Agent Spider.

Agent Spider is voiced by Josh Keaton, who previously voiced Spider-Man in The Spectacular Spider-Man cartoon.

title: miwa_mitsune
body:

h4. Appearance

She has [[orange eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]], often with an [[ahoge]] and [[swept bangs|swept]] and/or [[blunt bangs]].

In her daily life, she usually wears a [[grey hoodie]] with a [[print hoodie|print]] and [[pink pantyhose|pink]] or [[purple pantyhose|purple]] [[pantyhose]].

As a [[Magical Girl]], she can be seen wearing [[goggles]] [[goggles on head|on her head]], a [[black choker]], [[black tube top]], a [[black cloak|black]][[two-tone cloak|-and-]][[orange cloak|orange]] [[two-sided cloak]] with a [[mystical high collar]] and a [[binary]] print on the inside and a [[circuit board print]] on the outside; a [[black skirt|black]] [[checkered skirt|checkered]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[see-through skirt|see-through]] [[orange skirt|orange]] [[layered skirt|layer]] underneath, [[striped thighhighs|striped]] [[orange thighhighs|orange]] [[thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], [[orange sleeves|orange]] [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[striped sleeves|sleeves]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[knee boots]]. She fights using a [[stun gun]].

* !asset #23383651

She is voiced by [[Minase Inori]].

title: alphonse_elric
body:
A character from [[Fullmetal Alchemist]] and younger brother of [[Edward Elric]], referred as "Al" for short.

Alphonse's soul is bonded to a suit of [[armor]] after a botched attempt by him and Edward to revive their mother has costed him his entire body in an "equivalent exchange".

The calmer of the two, Al is tasked with keeping his brother in check. Is often mistaken as the older brother by others (much to Ed's chagrin) and for a robot by those outside the fanbase.

This tag is applicable to both Alphonse's armor form and his actual human form that he has regained at the end of FMA.

body:
A [[handheld game console]] released by [[Nintendo]] in February 2011. Successor to the [[Nintendo DS]].

New features include an autostereoscopic 3D upper screen, 360 degree analog slide pad, 3D-capable camera, telescopic stylus among other upgrades.

Not to be confused with the [[Nintendo DSi]]. The 3DS has a front camera, a circle pad above the D-pad, and its upper screen is wider than its lower screen.

title: i_want_to_live_(meme)
body:
[[Parody]] of a scene from the Enies Lobby arc of [[One Piece]], featuring [[Nico Robin]] [[crying|broke down in tears]] after learned that the [[Straw Hat pirates]] has come to rescue her from the [[CP9]], after she handed herself over to protect the group from being targeted by the World Government.

[spoiler]This particular line was said by Robin after [[Monkey D. Luffy]] urged her to say "I want to live!" to confirm that she wanted to stay with the group. Robin, whose entire life was ruined, betrayed, and manipulated by the World Government, felt that friendship offered by Luffy and the group was genuine, despite her used to be their enemy and believing that they would abandon her because of this. As such, the original scene was intended to solidify that Robin has finally been "freed" from the hands of the World Government.[/spoiler]

While the original scene was meant to be a heartfelt moment, parodies of this scene instead changed the context into the character in place of Robin begging for their lives as they were facing their doom.

title: chopper_crying_(meme)
body:
[b]Chopper Crying[/b] is a viral image of the character [[Tony Tony Chopper|Chopper]] from [[One Piece]] [[crying]] in the snow with visible breath coming from his mouth.

It became popularized as a reaction image and a source of redraws and ironic [[meme|memes]] in 2022 in connection with the virality of the [[The One Piece Is Real (meme)|One Piece Is Real]] and One Piece Cock Edit memes.

h4. See also
* "Chopper Crying on KnowYourMeme.com":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/chopper-crying]

title: the_one_piece_is_real_(meme)
body:
A bait-and-switch [[meme]], originally featuring a [[nude filter]] screencap of [[Edward Newgate]] from [[One Piece]], accompanied by his [spoiler]last[/spoiler] words "The One Piece!!.... The One Piece is real!!!" (referring to the eponymous treasure of the series).

The meme later includes various nude filters of other male characters from the series, along with being combined with [[chopper crying (meme)|a meme of]] [[Tony Tony Chopper]] [[crying]] at the end as a stand-in for the viewer's reaction after having seen the image.

The meme is accompanied by the song ""Dark Fantasy":[https://youtu.be/UTH1VNHLjng?t=23]" by Kanye West, specifically the part that samples the lyrics of the 1983 song ""In High Places":[https://youtu.be/oIWZ4dqKmJs?t=50]" by Mike Oldfield, giving rise to the meme's alternate name of "Can we get much higher?".

This tag is applicable when the image references any one of the nude filter images used in the meme.

title: neptune_(series)
body:
The Neptunia series is a series of games developed by [[Idea Factory]] and published by [[Compile Heart]].

The story is loosely based on the console wars and takes place in the world of Gamindustri (corrupted from [i]Game Industry[/i]) which is divided in multiple regions, each represented by a goddess which is the [[personification]] of a game console from major (and former) game console developer company. Also presenting personification of (mostly Japanese) game companies and some famous games.

Character designs were done by [[tsunako]].

h4.List of games
h5. Main
* [[Choujigen Game Neptune|Hyperdimension Neptunia]] (2010)
* [[Choujigen Game Neptune mk2|Hyperdimension Neptunia mk2]] (2011)
* [[Kami Jigen Game Neptune V|Hyperdimension Neptunia Victory]] (2012)
* [[Shin Jigen Game Neptune VII|Megadimension Neptunia VII]] (2015)
Remakes of the first three games in the series known as [b]Re;Birth[/b] were released for the PS Vita and later for PC via Steam. They mostly follow the storylines of original titles.

h5.Spinoffs
* [[kami jigen idol neptune pp|Hyperdimension Neptunia: Producing Perfection]] (2013)
* [[chou_megami_shinkou_noire_gekishin_black_heart|Hyperdevotion Noire: Goddess Black Heart]] (2014)
* [[choujigen_action_neptune_u|Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed]] (2014)
* [[gekijigen_tag:_blanc_+_neptune_vs_zombie_gundan|MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune vs Zombies]] (2015)
* [[choujigen_taisen_neptune_vs_sega_hard_girls|Superdimension Neptune VS Sega Hard Girls]] (2015)
* [[Four Goddesses Online: Cyber Dimension Neptune]] (2017)
* [[Brave Neptune|Super Neptunia RPG]] (2018)
* [[senran_nin_nin_ninja_taisen_neptune:_shoujo-tachi_no_kyouen|Neptunia x Senran Kagura: Ninja Wars]] (2021)
* [[Choujigen Game Neptune Sisters vs Sisters]] (2022)

h4. Characters
h6. Goddesses/CPUs

title: perona
body:
[[One Piece]] character. One of the "mysterious four", "Ghost Princess" Perona commanded the Wild and Surprise zombies aboard [[Thriller Bark]]. Commonly seen with her pet zombie/stuffed toy [[Kumacy]].

Having consumed the Horo Horo no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], she can create ghosts and project her spirit, in addition of being able to disable her enemy of the will to fight.

title: adeptus_custodes
body:
The Adeptus Custodes, renowned as the Golden Legion, the Brotherhood of Demigods, the Golden Brotherhood, and a host of other titles (The Custodian Guard, The Guardians, the Emperor’s Saints, the Watchers of The Throne, The Thousand Companions, The Ten Thousand), but most commonly known as Custodians, are the guardians of the Imperial Palace and the Golden Throne, as well as the personal bodyguard to the [[emperor_of_mankind|Emperor]]. Due to the vast size of the Imperial Palace, the Custodes always act as a defensive army.

Together with the [[anathema_psykana|Sisters of Silence]], they represented the Talons of the Emperor as the right hand of the Emperor. Custodians are the mightiest of mankind's warriors. They are to the Space Marines what those transhuman warriors are to common Guardsmen, an elevated elite whose raw strength and willpower are wholly insurmountable.

title: trafalgar_law
body:
[[One Piece]] character. One of the [[Eleven Supernova]] and captain and doctor of the Heart Pirates. He became one of the [[Shichibukai]], but his position was revoked for allying with [[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]].

Occasionally seen with close friend and crewmate [[Bepo]], though it is unknown exactly if Bepo is his first mate or not.

Having consumed the Ope Ope no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], he can create a "room" where he can separate and spatially displace anything and everything within it. This includes the ability to [[body switch|switching the body]] of his victim by exchanging their soul or detach/attach their limbs at his wish. Due to this ability, he is nicknamed "Surgeon of Death" for his combination of medical and combat skills.

Sometimes drawn alongside the [[Straw Hat Pirates]]' doctor [[Tony Tony Chopper]]. He is also often [[genderswap (mtf)|genderswapped]] as [[Law-chan]] due to an episode where Law and his crews were infected by a "feminization virus" which caused them to be temporarily transformed into women, which was perpetrated by [[Doc Q]].

It was later revealed that Trafalgar Law's [spoiler]full name[/spoiler] is [spoiler]Trafalgar D. Water Law[/spoiler], making him [spoiler]one of the carriers of the legendary "Will of the D."[/spoiler]

title: kiseijou_rei
body:
A antagonist from [[Kami Jigen Game Neptune V]], representing the [[Atari 2600]]. At first, she appears as an adorable, cute, beautiful but clumsy dork who tries to create a world without CPUs by spending her nights writing papers and passing them down.
She has light blue hair, a single horn in her human form, and has glasses.
[spoiler]And her HDD form, she has a leotard, loses the glasses, gain a second horn, and a slasher smile.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]She receives the power from her alternative self who was a CPU, go crazy, tries to destroy Gamindustri, succeeds in doing so unless the player wins, and has to clean Planeptune. By herself.[/spoiler]

She has an alternative Ultradimension self.
[spoiler]Her other self is a former CPU who was in charge of Tari (a reference to Atari), has her land crashing in flame (a reference to the Video Game Crash) and disappearing underground (a reference to all the ET cartridges buried in New Mexico desert), and is also an adorable, cute, beautiful but clumsy dork. On top of being a bit insane and a complete virgin who never held a boy's hand.[/spoiler]

She also appears in the anime.
[spoiler]In that one, she ends up in jail.[/spoiler]

Voiced by: [[Kobayashi Yuu]] (Japanese), Julie Ann Taylor (English, games), Morgan Garrett (English, anime)

title: isis-chan
body:
[[Personification]] of the [[terrorist]] organisation [[ISIS (terrorist group)|]] ([i]The Islamic State of Iraq and Syria[/i]).

She was made at "”ISISを萌え美少女化してイスラムの奴らに送りつけようずｗｗｗｗｗｗ”":http://viper.2ch.net/test/read.cgi/news4vip/1422098539/ (Let's make a moe personification of ISIS and send her to Muslim guys. LOLLOLLOLLOL) threads of [[2channel]]'s "News for VIP" Board. The first project/thread started on January 24, 2015.

After ISIS kidnapped and killed a Japanese journalist in 2014 and various brutal images of ISIS victims spread on Google Japan, Japanese artists started to draw gags and images of ISIS-chan in order to flood Google Images search results of ISIS in Japan. However, several rules for drawing ISIS-chan were created to prevent controversy in the future.

h5. Rules and Guidelines about creating ISIS-chan content.
1. Content must not be sexually suggestive and/or explicit.
2. Content must not contain violence.
3. Content must not contain racism.

h5. Profile

Name: ISIS-chan
Pronunciation of the name: Aishisu-chan (アイシスちゃん)
Costume: Black (like ISIS’s uniforms) 
Hairstyle: [[short_hair|Short]]
Hair color: [[black_hair|Black]] (but most Japanese artists draw her with [[green hair]])
Age: 19
Color of skin: [[dark_skin|Brown]]
Breasts: [[large_breasts|Large]]
Height: short (about 150cm, 4'10")
Eye color: [[green_eyes|Greenish]] 
Favorite food: [[melon|Muskmelons]]

h4. See also

* [[ISIS (terrorist group)]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: ISIS-chan":http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/isis-chan
* "Japanese Wiki":http://isis.wiki.fc2.com/

title: hime_cut
body:
A hairstyle consisting of [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair]], [[blunt bangs]], and [[sidelocks]] with [[blunt ends]].

All elements must be present to be considered a hime cut. The hair must be long and straight and the [[bangs]] and [[sidelocks]] must have blunt ends.

As the name suggests, the style is thought to have originated, or at least become common, in the Imperial court during the Heian Period of Japanese history, when noble women would sometimes [[absurdly long hair|grow out their hair for their entire lives]].

h4. Example
* !post #7467939
* !post #7546725
* !post #6280561
* !post #7507448

h4. See also

title: yayoi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Yayoi[/i]. Character design by [[Kusada Souta]], voiced by [[Hidaka Rina]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]] with [[short_hair_with_long_locks|long locks]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[black shirt]] with [[black sailor collar]], [[crescent hair ornament]], [[purple ribbon|purple]] [[neck ribbon]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] with white stripes, and [[grey footwear|grey shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back (with a flower attached), a 12 cm [[handgun]] mount (with Kisaragi's hair ribbon on the barrel), and two 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. 

She frequently has a sour face and a deadpan regard for what's going on around her.

The historical [i]Yayoi[/i] was sunk by air attack on September 11, 1942, off New Guinea.

title: zyuden_sentai_kyoryuger
body:
Zyuden Sentai Kyoryuger was Toei Company's 37th entry in its long-running [[Super Sentai]] Japanese tokusatsu television series following [[Tokumei Sentai Go-Busters]]. It aired on TV Asahi from February 17, 2013 to February 9, 2014.

In Korea, the Korean dub of Kyoryuger, known as [i]Power Rangers Dino Force[/i] (not to be confused with the Americanized adaptation [[Power Rangers Dino Charge]]), was so popular that it spawned a Korean sequel series, entitled Power Rangers Dino Force Brave, which was then dubbed into Japanese and aired as [i]Zyuden Sentai Kyoryuger Brave[/i].

title: yellow_magic_orchestra
body:
A Japanese electronic music band formed in 1978 by Haruomi Hosono, Ryuichi Sakamoto, and Yukihiro Takahashi. A pioneer in the use of synthesizers, samplers, and sequencers, the band helped define the synthpop, technopop, and electro genres.

h4. See also

* [[Solid State Survivor]]: second album of Yellow Magic Orchestra

title: solid_state_survivor
body: [[Yellow Magic Orchestra]]'s second album, one of the band's most iconic works, featuring more refined and accessible sound, solidifying Japanese technopop. Standout tracks include "Rydeen", which was performed in [[Hibike! Euphonium]] and rearranged in [[Highly Responsive to Prayers]] as Strange Oriental Discourse, and "Technopolis", which served as the basis for the track Solid State Scouter in [[Dragon Ball Z]]'s [[Bardock]] special.

title: frankensteiner
body:
The Frankensteiner is a professional [[wrestling]] move. It was named by Scott Steiner who used it as a finishing move.

The recipient of the move stands upright as the attacker jumps on their shoulders from the front, facing the opposite direction so that the recipient's face would be in the attacker's gut and the attacker's legs would be hanging over the back. Then the attacker does a back flip, landing on their head and arms and dragging the recipient over in the process. The recipient lands on their head or neck.

title: fujimar_rikka
body: A character appearing only in the novelization of [[fate/grand_order|Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[kogetsukan satsujin jiken|Murder at the Kogetsukan]] event. While she superficially resembles a blonde [[fujimaru_ritsuka_(male)|male Ritsuka Fujimaru]], she is actually a girl who binds her chest and is [[reverse_trap|crossdressing]] as a man. [spoiler]She is a college friend of Juliet's and was invited to the Kogetsukan to act as Juliet's pretend boyfriend to ward off advances from Morris. For much of the events of the story, she is possessed by the male Ritsuka Fujimaru.[/spoiler]

title: kogetsukan_satsujin_jiken
body:
[b]Murder at the Kogetsukan[/b]

[quote]
The story begins at the luxurious Kogetsukan Hotel.
You arrive there for what was meant to be a four-day, three-night stay.
A threatening letter delivered to the hotel turns out to be deadly serious when a guest is murdered.
As one of the characters drawn into this, you find yourself on a quest to uncover the culprit.
What truth will come to light during your seven-day investigation?
[/quote]

A murder mystery-themed event in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. It was guest-written by Madoi Ban and later adapted into a novel illustrated by [[Yamanaka Kotetsu]].

In it, Fujimaru Ritsuka has a dream where they witness a murder case unfold between a meeting of two crime families. All the characters in it are portrayed by servants Ritsuka is contracted to, due to their brain filling in missing details. [[Sherlock Holmes (fate)|]], [[James Moriarty (Archer) (fate)|]], and [[Mash Kyrielight]] end up helping guide Ritsuka to solving the mystery.

h4. Characters
* Aaron Goldie ([[Fionn mac Cumhaill (fate/grand order)|]])
** Member of the Goldie family. [spoiler]The patriarch of the family and the father of Morris and Lorie, with Dorthy as his second wife. Had affairs with both Harriet and Ann, and is the true father of Juliet, Eva, and Chris.[/spoiler]
* Dorthy Goldie ([[Marie Antoinette (fate)|]])
** Member of the Goldie family. [spoiler]Aaron's second wife, Morris' stepmother, and Lorie's mother.[/spoiler]
* Morris Goldie ([[Mordred (fate/apocrypha)|]])
** Member of the Goldie family. [spoiler]Eldest son of Aaron and his first wife.[/spoiler]
* Lorie Goldie ([[Paul Bunyan (fate)|]])
** Member of the Goldie family. [spoiler]The daughter of Aaron and Dorthy.[/spoiler]
* Adamska Violet ([[Lancelot (fate/grand order)|]])
** Father of the Violet family, who married into the family and took on their last name. [spoiler]While Cain is his legitimate son, when he married Harriet she was pregnant with Aaron's children, though this isn't public knowledge and the two are legally recognized as his children.[/spoiler]
* Eva Violet ([[Minamoto no Raikou (fate)|]])
** Member of the Violet family. [spoiler]Because she's represented by Raikou, Ritsuka mistakes her for being Adamska's wife, but she is actually Juliet's younger twin sister. She's the daughter of Aaron and Harriet from an affair, with Adamska as her legal father.[/spoiler]
* Juliet Violet ([[Stheno (fate)|]])
** Member of the Violet family. Attends college with Rikka, and is the reason they were at the meeting of the Goldie and Violet families. [spoiler]Eldest daughter of Adamska and Harriet, with Eva being her younger twin sister. Correctly guessed by players as the true culprit behind the murders.[/spoiler]
* Harriet Violet ([[Euryale (fate)|]])
** Member of the Violet family. [spoiler]Because she's represented by Euryale, Ritsuka mistakes her for being Juliet's sister, but she's actually Juliet & Eva's mother. She became pregnant with twins after an affair with Aaron, marrying Adamska and having them legally recognized as their children. Cain is her youngest child.[/spoiler]
* Cain Violet ([[Mephistopheles (fate)|]])
** Member of the Violet family. [spoiler]Raised as the brother of Juliet and Eva, but is actually their half-sibling, having a different father than the twins.[/spoiler]
* Hawthorne ([[James Moriarty (Archer) (fate)|]])
** Family doctor of the Violets.
* Ann ([[Jaguarman (fate)|]])
** Member of the Marble trading company and a long-time business partner of Aaron Goldie. [spoiler]The mother of Chris, who she had from an affair with Aaron, though she kept his parentage secret, not recognizing him as her son.[/spoiler]
* Wu ([[Yan Qing (fate)|]])
** Martial artist working for the Marble trading company. Mentioned in [[Fate/strange fake]] to have once fought [[Bazdilot Cordelion]].
* Chris ([[Bedivere (fate)|]])
** Member of the Marble trading company, with Ann as his primary caretaker. [spoiler]Is actually Ann's son, born from a one-time affair with Aaron, though he's unaware of his parentage.[/spoiler]
* [[fujimar_rikka|Rikka Fujimar]] (Ritsuka Fujimaru)
** A college student who was invited to the island by their friend Juliet. [spoiler]Portrayed in the novel as a [[reverse trap|cross-dressing woman]] [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[look-alike]] for the [[Fujimaru Ritsuka (Male)|male Ritsuka]], who attended as Juliet's pretend boyfriend in order to ward off advances from Morris.[/spoiler]
* Sherringham ([[Sherlock Holmes (fate)|]])
** [spoiler]Believed by Ritsuka to be someone identified as having the appearance of Holmes like the others, but is actually Holmes himself taking on a false role.[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[Madou Meihou-sou no Kousatsu]]

title: battle_of_britain
body:
[quote][i]"Never in the field of human conflict was so much owed by so many to so few...":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Never_was_so_much_owed_by_so_many_to_so_few[/i] - British Prime Minister [[Winston Churchill]] describing the ongoing battle.[/quote] 

[b]The Battle of Britain[/b] (German: [i]Die Luftschlacht um England[/i], "The Air Battle for England") was a [[military]] campaign of [[World War II]], in which the outnumbered [[Royal Air Force]] (RAF) and the Fleet Air Arm (FAA) of the Royal Navy successfully defended the [[United Kingdom]] (UK) against large-scale attacks by Nazi Germany's (then) massive air force, the [[Luftwaffe]]. 

The battle took place a month after the [[Dunkirk Evacuation]]. It was the first step before the intended subsequent invasion of Britain by the Germans ([i]"Operation Sea Lion":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Sea_Lion[/i]).

The battle was the first major military campaign fought entirely by air forces. The RAF was also supported by several squadrons of Polish pilots who escaped to Britain after the conquest of [[Poland]] by Nazi Germany. The British officially recognise the battle's duration as being from 10 July until 31 October 1940, which overlaps the period of large-scale night attacks known as [b]the Blitz[/b], that lasted from 7 September 1940 to 11 May 1941.

The battle ended with a British victory after they regained air superiority over the island. The failure of the Luftwaffe to subdue the UK along with the beginning of the invasion of the Soviet Union resulted into a cancellation of the planned invasion of Britain, allowing the UK and western allies to refocus their war effort to the North Africa campaign.

title: atomic_bombings_of_hiroshima_and_nagasaki
body:
Referring to the [b]Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki[/b], a [[nuclear_weapon|nuclear bomb]] attack on [[japan|Japanese]] cities of [[Hiroshima]] and [[Nagasaki]] by the [[United States]] to end [[World War II]].

The large numbers of American casualties in the battles of [[Iwo Jima]] and [[battle_of_okinawa|Okinawa]], Japan's refusal to surrender and the projected casualties during "the upcoming invasion of the Japanese home islands":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Downfall (which some experts considered to be as high as a million dead or injured American soldiers) were some of the arguments in favor of these operations.

The first attack was carried out in 6 August 1945 on Hiroshima and second attack on Nagasaki in 9 August 1945. Resulted in over 200,000 deaths. 

It remains the first and only time in the history of the human race that atomic weapons were ever used in warfare.

h4. See Also
* [[B-29 Superfortress]]

title: azov_battalion
body:
The [b]Azov Regiment[/b] is a 900 men unit of Ukraine's national gendarmerie (National Guard of Ukraine). First based in Mariupol and initially formed as a volunteer militia during the [[Russo-Ukrainian war]], it has participated in eight engagements. The unit was founded in May 2014 as a volunteer paramilitary militia under the command of "Andriy Biletsky":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andriy_Biletsky] to fight pro-Russian forces in the Donbas War, and was formally incorporated into the National Guard on 11 November 2014.

The group has drawn controversy over its early and allegedly continuing association with far-right groups and neo-[[Nazi]] ideology, its early use of controversial symbols linked to Nazism (the [[black sun (symbol)|]], the [[Wolfsangel]] and the [[swastika]]), and allegations that members of the group have participated in torture and war crimes.  However, some experts argue that the regiment has evolved beyond its origins as street militia, tempering its neo-Nazi underpinnings as it became part of the Ukranian National Guard. 

Since 2014, criticism of the Azov Regiment has been a recurring theme of Russian politics and more recently as [[Vladimir Putin]]'s justification for invading Ukraine, the prominence of the unit in Ukraine's military forces being expanded and exaggerated by Russian media to this day.

The most recent official Azov Regiment logo now only uses a heavily altered Wolfsangel symbol, while the SSO (special forces) units don't use it at all (they use a [[tryzub]] formed out of swords instead).

h4. See also

* [[Marichka]]
* [[Russo-Ukrainian war]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Azov Regiment":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Azov_Regiment]
* "YouTube: History and Symbols of the Azov Regiment":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HGdUtUefjCA]

title: dongtan_dress
body:
A [[tight clothes|tight]], muted color (typically [[grey dress|grey]] or [[black dress|black]]) [[pencil dress]] with low neckline to show [[cleavage]], usually accompanied with an open, [[cropped jacket]] of the same color. The [[long sleeves]] may alternatively be part of the dress. A [[meme attire|fashion meme]] originating from South Korea.

In South Korea, it is often joked on the Internet that the new town area of Dongtan (동탄) has an unusually high number of rich, young married women wearing such dresses, spending time at shopping malls or cafes while their husbands are at work. Dongtan New Town is statistically one of the youngest in the country in terms of average age of residents, with one district scoring as low as 33.5 in September 2023. The township has been perceived as where a number of young married couples wishing to keep the capital area in close reach reside, where most infrastructures of South Korea are concentrated at an extreme density.

The meme has gained traction in 2023 and the name Dongtan has since been used on any young woman dressed in any revealing clothes, practically replacing any sexually suggestive keyword in Korea, with characters such as [[Dongtan Lady (k pring)|]] popping up.

h4. Examples
* !post #7558897: Default
* !post #7627481: [[Sleeveless dress|Sleeveless]] version

title: pencil_dress
body:
A close-fitting [[dress]] with a straight, narrow cut. Generally the hemline ranges from skirt length to miniskirt length, and is tailored for a close fit.

The difference between a [[pencil dress]] and a [[tube dress]] is that a [[tube dress]] is always [[strapless]]. A [[pencil dress]] can have straps or a [[halterneck]], and is applicable to all non-strapless dresses with a tight-fitting lower half.

[[Hestia (danmachi)|]]'s white dress is an example of a pencil dress, due to the skirt portion of her dress fitting tightly around/below her hips.

h4. See also
* [[dongtan dress]]
* [[hobble dress]]
* [[pencil skirt]]
* [[taut dress]]
* [[tube dress]]

title: moshi_koi_ga_mieta_nara
body:
A [[yuri]] manga written by "Mikami Teren":https://twitter.com/teren_mikami and illustrated by [[Nanaji Yuuki]].

Ever since she was young, Haruno Mei has had the ability to see pink arrows that tell her which person someone loves. Following many hardships that came with this ability, Mei begins attending an all-girls' boarding school in the hopes of never getting involved with romance again. However, she discovers that her childhood friend Shirayuki Saya and her new classmate Fukatsu Rinna both have arrows pointing towards her.

h4. External Links

* "MyAnimeList: Moshi, Koi ga Mieta Nara":https://myanimelist.net/manga/131570

title: italian_senate_porn_livestream_(meme)
body:
An event in January 2022 in which a [[Zoom chat|Zoom]] meeting of the Italian Senate was interrupted by a troll streaming a [[3D]] [[video]] of [[Tifa Lockhart]] having sex. An uncut version of the video also shows the troll browsing a Discord channel and changing to a video of [[Xiangling (genshin impact)|]] for a couple seconds before it gets abruptly cut off.

The video played during the meeting was post #5066023 by [[Juicyneko]].
The second video played during the meeting was post #5081770 by [[Dragk]], which is an animated version of post #4545618 by [[Nyantcha]].

title: pittsburgh_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the US Navy heavy cruiser USS [i]Pittsburgh[/i] (CA-72). 

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[black hair]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit is overall similar to [[Baltimore (azur lane)|her sister Baltimore]], which consists of a dark [[blue coat]] worn [[coat on shoulders|on her shoulders]] and [[clothes writing|with her name on it]], a [[black leotard|two-]][[white leotard|tone]] [[leotard]] with a [[navel cutout]], [[black gloves]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two separate hull pieces held together to her back, containing all three of her 203 mm triple gun mounts, two 127 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]], and aircraft cranes.

title: akitsu_maru_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese army escort carrier [i]Akitsu Maru[/i]. Character designed by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Noto Mamiko]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], [[black eyes]], and [[pale skin]]. Her default outfit is a grey [[military uniform]]: [[peaked cap]], [[grey shirt]], [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt]], [[grey thighhighs]], [[white footwear|white]], [[sneakers]], white [[randoseru]], and a pouch. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a hull piece to her left, her island to her right, and her [[flight deck]] with a [[camouflage]] pattern on her left arm. 

She looks drastically different than the rest of the entire cast of shipgirls with her pure white skin and contrasting clothing, which makes it easy to mistake her as an [[abyssal ship]]. 

h4. Appearance

title: white_flag
body:
A white flag is a flag with solid white color. Used as a sign of [[surrendering|truce]], often as a request for negotiation. The white flag is popularly known as a symbol of surrender. In racing it can mean "slow moving vehicle ahead" for [[federation_internationale_de_l'automobile|FIA]]-sanctioned races or "final lap" for [[IndyCar Series|IndyCar]] and [[NASCAR]].

h4. External links

title: ribbon_bar
body:
Also called service ribbon or medal ribbon. They are often a part of [[military uniform|military]] or [[police uniform|police]] [[uniform]]s, and usually appear as the colorful stripes seen above one of the breast pockets.

Ribbon bars are pieces of fabric mounted on a small metal bar equipped with an attaching device. They represent various awards or accomplishments of the individual or of the sub-group (squad, division, platoon, etc.) the individual is a part of.

h4. See also

* [[medal]]
* [[peaked cap]]
* [[garrison cap]]
* [[military uniform]]
* [[formal clothes]]
* [[military dress uniform]]
* [[naval dress uniform]]
* [[military rank insignia]]

h4. Image Example

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Service ribbon":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Service_ribbon]

title: white_hair
body:
Hair that is colored white.

Due to the subjective nature of color judgment, lighting, and color grading, there can be confusion between white hair and other hair colors in the very light color range. This especially true in regards to [[blue hair]], [[purple hair]], and [[grey hair]]. A good idea is to compare the hair color to any other white objects in the picture. If the hair is the same color, it should be tagged [[white hair]]. If it is darker or differently-colored, use the appropriate non-white tag.

h4. Examples

* !post #7338612

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Hair color]]

title: fortnite
body:
A free-to-play third-person shooter developed by Epic Games, notable for spearheading the surge in popularity for battle royale games and featuring collaboration events with other entertainment franchises and real-world music artists. Some of the copyrights that have collaborated with the game include [[Boku no hero academia]], [[DC Comics]], [[Dragon Ball Super]], [[El Chapulin Colorado (Series)|]], [[Family Guy]], [[Futurama]], [[Jujutsu Kaisen]], [[Invincible (series)|Invincible]], [[Marvel]], [[Star Wars]], [[Naruto Shippuuden]] and [[Rick and Morty]].
 It is currently available for [[PlayStation 4]], [[PlayStation 5]], [[Xbox One]], [[Xbox Series X]], [[Nintendo Switch]], [[computer|PC]], and [[smartphone]]s.

The game has become the subject of many [[meme]]s due to its silly dance emotes, primarily minor playerbase, and the absurdity of its collab events.

body:
A song and costume by [[love live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club|Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. 

It features a [[coat dress]] in the wearer's image color and with their name [[clothes writing|written on the back]]. They may also hold an unusually long [[penlight (glowstick)|]].

Its performance in [[Ijigen Fes Idolmaster Love Live! Utagassen]] spawned a variety of fanart, featuring various idols donning the [[banchou]]-like uniform.

title: sagohzo_(ooo_combo)
body:
One of [[Kamen Rider OOO]]'s combos, accessed via the Rhino (Sai), Gorilla, and Elephant (Zou) Core Medals.

OOO now gains superhuman strength, [[earth (element)|earth]] control and gravity manipulation as well the ability to perform strong headbutts through the Sai Head, the Bagoon Pressure attack by firing the Gori Bagoon gauntlets from the Gorilla Arms, and also create powerful shockwaves by banging his chest through the Gorilla Arms, and cause minor earthquakes with the Zou Legs, including a powerful drop attack called the Zuo Stomp.

Although Sagohzo Combo is the toughest and strongest of the first five Full Combos, its jumping height is considered to be weaker and it has the slowest running speed. His Scanning Charge is the Sagohzo Impact, where OOO manipulates gravity to lift him into the air and weights himself down to hit the ground with a powerful stomp, trapping an enemy in the ground that forms around it while the reformed ground moves toward OOO where he delivers a powerful double-handed punch and headbutt at the same time.

title: shauta_(ooo_combo)
body:
One of [[Kamen Rider OOO]]'s combos, accessed via the Orca (Shachi), Eel (Unagi), and Octopus (Tako) Core Medals.

OOO now excels in [[underwater]] [[battle|battles]] and gains the ability to liquefy his body like [[Kamen Rider BLACK RX]] as the Bio Rider. He is armed with the Denki Unagi Whips which enable [[electricity|electrically]] charged attacks, the most powerful being the Voltarm Whip. The Tako Legs allow OOO Shauta to climb walls with their suction cup-like abilities and can split apart for a barrage of hits. Although Shauta is better well-suited for underwater combat, it's also very weaker than the other combos due to its punching and kicking power, but it has fantastic flexibility. He can also perform an echolocation via the Shachi Head.

His Scanning Charge is the Octo Banish, where OOO liquefies his lower body to propel himself upward, then use the Unagi Whips to drag the opponent upward while OOO goes back down using the Tako Legs to form a [[drill]] to burst through the opponent.

title: kamen_rider_ooo
body:
Titular Rider of [[Kamen Rider OOO (series)|]], twenty-first show of the Kamen Rider series and twelfth of the Heisei generation.

[[Hino Eiji]] is a world-traveling vagrant with no long-term job, whose recent stint as a museum guard drags him into a tournament between the Greeed, five creatures competing for the title of "Multi King" after an 800-year-slumber. Finding himself an unwitting pawn of the bird-type Greeed Ankh, Eiji fights the Yummy, monsters materialized by Greeed from human desires and which serve as their pawns, as Kamen Rider OOO.
Like [[Kamen Rider Double|his immediate predecessor]], OOO takes on various Combos by placing three Core Medals ([[O Medal]]s taken from the Greeed) at once on his OOO Driver, his default Combo being the [[TaToBa (OOO Combo)|TaToBa (Hawk/Tiger/Grasshopper) Combo]].

title: token_black
body: Token Black, is a fictional character in the adult animated television series [[South Park]]. He was voiced by Trey Parker in early appearances, but South Park art director Adrien Beard took over in 2000 and has performed the character since. The character's name was originally "Token" as a play on tokenism. His name was retconned in the episode "The Big Fix" to Tolkien, after [[tolkien's_legendarium|J. R. R. Tolkien]].

title: butters_stotch
body:
A [[South Park]] character. He is the sweet, good-natured, innocent, sensitive, effeminate and idealistic little boy of the school, if a bit socially awkward. His reputation makes him a frequent target for harassment, bullying, manipulation and exploitation by the more mature and foul-mouthed boys — especially Cartman — in addition to being the only child of his two Abusive Parents, Stephen and Linda. Despite his regular humiliations, Butters can still grow a spine at the most unexpected of moments.

h4. See also
* [[Marjorine]]

title: eve_(eversoul)
body:
A Demon-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]]. [spoiler]She was originally an Angel-type Soul until a certain unfortunate event.[/spoiler]
CV: Lee Hyeon-jin (Korean)
[hr]
The very first Soul given physical form by Dr. Angelica Faust [spoiler](at least on record)[/spoiler]. She is a highly-intellectual Soul with the unfortunate innate ability to beguile those who lay their eyes upon her, regardless of gender. Due to this, all the powerful Souls created by humanity were based on her image, leading to the rarity of male Souls in general. [spoiler]When Faust refused to give up Eve after humanity's desire for her remained unabated, they created an excuse for them to forcibly capture and corrupt her as Eve once attempted to create one of her own kind. When even the corruption of Eve wasn't enough, worldwide tensions escalated up until World War III was unleashed and the apocalyptic Apollyon was summoned, leading to the demise of mankind on Earth.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]She is also one of two primordial Souls created by the Transcendents to watch over and ensure the world's eternal recurrence alongside her "sibling" [[Dark Knight (Eversoul)|Adam]].[/spoiler]

In Eden, her name is associated with the Goddess worshipped by those that follow the Eve Faith, a monotheistic religion that believes in a "Goddess Eve," the Primal Soul who created the Souls in her image and disappeared sometime after guiding the world's first Souls, much to her disappointment and chagrin.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Tablet of Fate":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tablet_of_Destinies_(mythic_item)][/i].

title: erusha_(eversoul)
body:
An Undead-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: [[Jang Ye-na]] (Korean) | [[Shiraishi Haruka (voice actor)|]] (Japanese)
[hr]
A belly dancer contracted under the Arkenine-based talent agency Bestie Production, owned by the eccentric songwriter [[Onyx_(eversoul)|]]. Has a tendency to get very chatty and may even speak at a faster rate than the average Soul.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Vajra":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vajra][/i].

title: kamen_rider_bitter_gavv
other_names: 仮面ライダービターガヴ

title: erika_(eversoul)
body:
A Fairy-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Kim Ga-ryung (Korean) | [[Kubo Yurika]] (Japanese)
[hr]
A genius alchemist running an atelier in Arkenine, with sponsorship from [[Jade_(eversoul)|]]'s Merchants' Guild. Her concocted potions are second to none, but the same cannot be said about her socialization prowess. She's rather withdrawn and prone to overthinking her actions in public, but she reveals her true self once one starts talking about the children's show "Professor Teddy" with her.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Elixir of Life":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elixir_of_life][/i].

title: eileen_(eversoul)
body:
A Humanlike-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Son Seon-yeong (Korean)
[hr]
The infamous guild leader of Spades, the most notorious thieves' guild in the Kingdom of Troyca. Her penchant for thieving and gambling masks the reason why she established the guild in the first place: to seek out a volatile magical gem called the Void Crystal and destroy it before it gets another chance to become destructive enough to erase whole buildings and Souls alike.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Harpe":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harpe][/i].

title: edith_(eversoul)
body:
A Fairy-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Kim Sung-hee (Korean)
[hr]
Once the second princess of the Tabrian Empire, she left her life of royalty behind after being entranced by the gentle kindness of Solrey's Queen [[Yuria_(eversoul)|]] during one of her visits to Tabria. Nowadays, she works as deputy commander of the Order of Blackhawk under the leadership of Commander [[Linzy_(eversoul)|]]. She appears regal and composed at first glance, but her previous life of luxury has left her unable to take care of herself in things like housework and daily routines. She's learning, but she still has a long way to go before she can really call herself an independent woman and stop receiving constant letters from Crown Princess [[Hazel_(eversoul)|]]...

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Balisarda":[https://en.namu.wiki/w/%EB%B0%94%EB%A6%AC%EC%82%AC%EB%8B%A4][/i].

title: dora_(eversoul)
body:
A Humanlike-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Kim Yea-lim (Korean) | Tanaka Takako (Japanese)
[hr]
A Fayren Forest Keeper with a deep attachment to anything bear-related. Having been essentially raised by forest bears upon her first awakening in Eden, she adores all kinds of bears and wants to meet one of each bear at least once in her long lifetime, currently working as a Forest Keeper to gather travel funds to go to Chalar to meet polar bears. Alongside her adoration for bears is her self-made martial arts style of "Bearjutsu," a fighting style that has her fight in the frontlines as if she were a bear herself.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Bowl of Goldilocks":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goldilocks_and_the_Three_Bears][/i].

title: trianne_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A [i][[Honkai: Star Rail]][/i] character. A member of the [[Chrysos Heirs (honkai: star rail)|]], voiced by [[Toono Hikaru]] in Japanese. 

She is portrayed [[Tribbie (honkai: star rail)|as a]] [[Trinnon (honkai: star rail)|trio]] all having [[red hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[cross-shaped pupils]]. Their shared default outfit consists of [[white flower|white]] [[hair flower]]s, [[white dress]], [[black gloves]], golden [[angel wings]], and [[mismatched footwear|differently-colored]] [[winged footwear|winged boots]] ([[white footwear|white]] on left and [[black footwear|black]] on right). 

However, distinguishing her from the other [[triplets]], Trianne's [[hair over one eye|hair covers one of her eyes]], and she has a sassier personality than the other two.

title: lila_milla_rira
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] series. She first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985. 

A regular [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] veteran who isn't too fond of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] but fights alongside them anyway because she is ordered to do so. 

[b]Lila Milla Rira[/b] is a skillful [[mecha]] [[pilot]], able to control the notoriously finicky [[Galbaldy Beta]] [[mobile suit]]. [spoiler]However, even her experience and skills are not enough to defeat [[Kamille Bidan]] in his [[Gundam Mk II]] mobile suit who shots her down in a [[space]] [[duel]] early in the series, Lila realizing in her last moments how helpless "oldtypes" are against the powers of "newtypes" like Kamille. This encounter would worsen the animosity between Kamille and [[Jerid Messa]] even further, as Jerid was secretely in love with the older woman.[/spoiler]
other_names: ライラ・ミラ・ライラ

title: hoshimachi_suisei
body:
A [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] who originally started as an [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] before joining [[hololive]]'s music label [i]INNK Music[/i]. She would later transfer to hololive proper and become part of hololive's "[[0th Generation (hololive)|Generation 0]]".

Her appearance was designed by herself, as well as the costumes from her indie days. She got a new design from [[Teshima Nari]] after joining hololive, with her newer costumes being designed by [[Saekiyahiro]].

She has [[blue eyes]] with [[star in eye|stars]] in them and [[blue hair|blue]] [[medium hair]] with [[double-parted bangs]] hanging [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]], [[sidelocks]] and a [[side ponytail]] held with a [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[hair ribbon|ribbon]].

title: galbaldy_alpha
body:
A fictional manned giant combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]MS-17 Galbaldy α[/b]

A [[Zeon]] modified version of the [[Gyan]] [[mobile_suit|MS]], made with the [[Gelgoog]]'s innovations in mind, such as the potent [[beam rifle]] it carried. Not many were produced and most were captured by the [[Earth Federation]] at the end of [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]], where they would be significantly modified into the [[Galbaldy Beta]].

title: dominique_(eversoul)
body:
A Fairy-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Kim Chae-rin (Korean)
[hr]
She is the current queen of the Kingdom of Troyca, a wealthy nation dominated by merchants and aristocrats. Before becoming queen however, she was a simple commoner that wanted to learn as much as she could under educational policies established by the former Troycan queen only known by the title of "The Queen of All Things," only for said queen to gain an interest in Dominique, giving her the right to succeed her should anything happen to her. Following the Queen of All Things's death and pending resurrection after losing her life during a major Gate incident around 50 years before the events of the game, Dominique became queen despite protests from the aristocracy. In spite of her crippling social anxiety and rampant opposition from the wealthy, she wishes to narrow the gap between the rich and the poor by creating more robust policies in commerce and education, with support from [[Jade_(eversoul)|]]'s Merchants' Guild, the most powerful merchant group in Eden.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Rhongomyniad":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rhongomyniad][/i].

title: catherine_(radiance)_(eversoul)
body:
A Chaotic-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]]. This alternate version of [[Catherine_(eversoul)|]] is based on plot advancement from Chapter 7, [spoiler]being a fusion of her and [[Rose_(eversoul)|]][/spoiler].
CV: Lee Ji-yeong (Korean)
[hr]
[spoiler]Shortly after becoming Regent of Solrey due to Queen [[Yuria_(eversoul)|]]'s disappearance and subsequent reawakening as the harbinger of the apocalypse Apollyon, she wore a prototype version of the Crown of the Sun, a powerful magitech device capable of maintaining Solrey's healthy and bountiful lands in exchange for the wearer's mana. However, as Catherine is a normal Humanlike-type compared to Yuria's more powerful Angel-type, the crown started to consume her very soul, causing a mysterious dark entity to encroach upon her heart and start to corrupt her. Luckily, she was saved because of Rose fusing her own ANIMA into the crown to stabilize her existence. This led to the creation of Eden's first Chaotic-type Soul, giving Catherine the power over sacred flames in tandem with her power to protect others with her shielding magic. However, this also led to Rose's soul becoming trapped within the crown itself, leaving her physical body in a vegetative state. Now, Catherine must find a way to survive the encroaching apocalypse if she wants to find a way to bring Rose back to the material world...[/spoiler]

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Holy Shroud":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shroud_of_Turin] of Splendid Radiance[/i].

title: magnus_the_red
body:
[[Warhammer 40K]] character. [[Primarch]] of the XVth [[adeptus astartes|Legiones Astartes]], the [[Thousand Sons]].

Magnus usually relied on his immense psychic power for battle, but was equipped with regular weaponry. He was typically seen wielding a massive [[Khopesh]] known as the [[Blade of_Ahn Nunurta]] and an energy weapon dubbed the Psyfire Serpenta. He wore an [[Ornate armor|ornate]] suit of [[Power Armor]] with many [[Engraved armor|engravings]] and wardings known as the Horned Raiment. By the 41st Millennium, the Daemon Primarch Magnus was equipped with the [[Blade of Magnus]] and the [[Crown of the Crimson King]].

title: inugami_korone_(loungewear)
body:
The 4th/loungewear [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Inugami Korone]].

It consists of a [[pink jacket|pink]] [[hooded jacket]] with a [[dog hood]] and long [[fur-trimmed sleeves]] and [[shoulder cutout]]s (or a [[hooded vest]] with [[detached sleeves]], depending on the artist) a [[black shirt|black]] [[t-shirt]] with a [[dog print|dog]] and [[bone print|bones]] [[print shirt|print]] with [[shoulder cutout]]s (although it's often depicted as just a [[black tank top]]), a [[black choker|black]] [[o-ring choker]] with a finger-shaped [[pendant]], [[blue shorts|blue]] [[denim shorts|denim]] [[short shorts]], a black [[thigh strap]], [[striped legwear|striped]] [[two-tone legwear|two-toned]] [[pink socks|pink]] and [[white socks|white]] [[loose socks]] and [[cat print]] [[slippers]], that match with Okayu's 3rd costume dog slippers.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has her [[long hair]] [[hair over shoulder|over her shoulder]] with a [[pom pom hair ornament]] with an optional [[pink hairband|pink]] [[hair bow|bow]] [[bow hairband|hairband]] [[bangs pinned back|holding her bangs back]].

title: lambdadelta
body:
Character from [[Umineko no Naku Koro ni]]. [[Witch]] of Certainty. Able to kill anyone with 100% certainty.

"Lambdadelta" (λδ) represents thirty-four when using Greek numerals. The characters "mi" and "yo" can be written as the numbers three and four.

She has [[red eyes]], [[small breasts]], and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with bangs. She wears a [[pink hat|pink]] [[beret]] with [[red bow|red]] [[hat bow]]s, a [[hair bow]], [[pearl necklace]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], a [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[pink dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] & [[dress bow]], [[jack-o'-lantern]] ornament, [[striped socks|striped]] [[pink socks|pink]] & [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[high heels]].

h4. See Also

* [[Houjou Satoko]].

She is a [[office lady]] whose attire usually consists of a [[black jacket|black]] [[blazer]], a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[shirt]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt|pencil]] [[skirt]], and [[pink pantyhose]] or [[brown thighhighs]]
